Name: Continental Sour
Ingredients: 15 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
15 ml Egg white (pasteurised) or 																																			Aquafaba (chickpea water)																								 or 3 dashes Fee Brothers Fee Foam cocktail foamer
Instructions: Select and pre-chill an Old-fashioned glass .
SHAKE first 5 ingredients with ice and strain back into shaker.
DRIZZLE port over surface of cocktail.
Review: A Whiskey Sour made 'continental' by the addition of a splash of port.
History: Adapted from a recipe discovered in May 2010 at Stagger Lee bar in Berlin, Germany.
Nutrition: One serving of Continental Sour contains 222 calories
